intro: Betckea major, commonly known as the large betcha, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the Myrtaceae family and is characterized by its shrub-like growth habit. The plant features narrow, lance-shaped leaves and produces clusters of small, white or pinkish flowers. Betckea major is often found in dry, sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments. It plays a role in supporting local pollinators and is of interest in ecological and botanical studies.
